content.body:
Hi guys wondering if there is an existing proposal for the non-null assertion operator?

e.g. 

```
getFoo()! // will throw if undefined or null is returned
```
content.formatted_body:
Hi guys wondering if there is an existing proposal for the non-null assertion operator?

e.g.

getFoo()! // will throw if undefined or null is returned

content.body: No proposal for it as I know

interesting, seems like an obvious thing which I would find super useful. I'm writing this code all day long

```
const foo = getFoo()
assert(foo, 'missing foo')
```
content.formatted_body:
interesting, seems like an obvious thing which I would find super useful. I'm writing this code all day long

const foo = getFoo()
assert(foo, 'missing foo')

content.body: I only just today realized that the `flatMap` methods in the iterator helpers proposal can take a generator; I love that
content.formatted_body: I only just today realized that the flatMap methods in the iterator helpers proposal can take a generator; I love that

content.body: i love it when a plan comes together
PSA: There is the monthly Records&Tuples call tomorrow, 16th, 7pm UTC
The spec lists #tc39 on freenode as the official IRC, but I can't seem to access it
I think it’s changed in the latest draft spec since es2021 was published
content.formatted_body: I think it’s changed in the latest draft spec since es2021 was published

content.body: Seems you may have found a dead spec... always use the living spec, https://tc39.es/ecma262/
